newsitem.title: USA: PaperClip delisted from Nasdaq SmallCap.
newsitem.headline: PaperClip delisted from Nasdaq SmallCap.

text.p: PaperClip Software Inc said Thursday its securities have been delisted from the Nasdaq SmallCap Market due to its failure to comply with minimum asset and capital requirements.
PaperClip, which went public in 1995, said its securities will be quoted on the Over-the-Counter Bulletin Board.
PaperClip makes software for document management and imaging systems, primarily for use in networking systems.

In January, Access Solutions International Inc said it would buy the assets and certain liabilities of PapeClip for $5.79 million in a stock deal. It said the two firms would operate under the Access name once the deal was complete, but the PaperClip product name would be retained.
William Weiss, a PaperClip official, said by telephone that the deal was proceeding.
